meanings.def: to make water, air, gas, etc. flow in a particular direction by using a pump or something that works like a pump
examples: pump something (+ adv./prep.) The engine is used for pumping water out of the mine.
The heart pumps blood around the body.
It took ages to pump out the cellar (= pump the water out of it) after the flood.
pump something + adj. The lake had been pumped dry.
His heart pumped harder as he held his breath.
The lungs pump oxygen into the bloodstream.

meanings.def: to flow in a particular direction as if it is being forced by a pump
examples: Blood was pumping out of his wound.
The shock sent adrenalin pumping through her veins.

meanings.def: to move something quickly up and down or in and out
examples: He kept pumping my hand up and down.
I pumped the handle like crazy.

meanings.def: to move quickly up and down or in and out
examples: She sprinted for the line, legs pumping.
My heart was pumping with excitement.

meanings.def: to try to get information from somebody by asking them a lot of questions
examples: See if you can pump him for more details.

meanings.def: to fire a lot of bullets into somebody
to fill somebody with something, especially drugs
examples: They pumped her full of painkillers.

meanings.def: to do exercises in which you lift heavy weights in order to make your muscles stronger
to remove the contents of somebody’s stomach using a pump, because they have swallowed something harmful
examples: He had his stomach pumped after taking an overdose.

idioms.idiom: pump bullets, shots, etc. into somebody
idioms.def: to fire a lot of bullets into somebody
to fill somebody with something, especially drugs
examples: They pumped her full of painkillers.

idioms.def: to do exercises in which you lift heavy weights in order to make your muscles stronger
to remove the contents of somebody’s stomach using a pump, because they have swallowed something harmful
examples: He had his stomach pumped after taking an overdose.

meanings.def: a machine that is used to force liquid, gas or air into or out of something
examples: (British English) a petrol pump
(North American English) a gas pump
a foot/hand pump (= that you work by using your foot or hand)
a bicycle pump
She washed her face at the pump in front of the inn.

meanings.def: a light simple sports shoe made of canvas (= strong cotton cloth) with a rubber sole
a woman’s formal shoe that is plain and does not cover the top part of the foot
a woman’s light, soft flat shoe worn for dancing or exercise; a similar style of shoe worn as a fashion item
examples: ballet pumps

meanings.def: everyone helps or must help, especially in a difficult situation
examples: There are 30 people coming to dinner tonight, so it's all hands on deck.

meanings.def: to encourage the growth of a new or weak business or industry by putting money into it
